newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Energy to conduct seismic survey in Akita.
newsitem.headline: Japan Energy to conduct seismic survey in Akita.

text.p: Japan Energy Corp said on Monday it plans to start a three-dimensional seismic survey in Honjyo, Akita Prefecture in northern Japan, in November to evaluate potential crude and natural gas reserves.
It will complete the survey by the end of the year and finish checking the data by next summer, a Japan Energy spokesman said.
The refiner will sink test wells as early as 1998 if the data shows promising possibilities, he said.
The survey is expected to cost 350 million yen, half of which will be shouldered by the government, he added.
Japan Petroleum Exploration Co Ltd is producing 40,000 cubic metres (1.4 million cubic feet) of natural gas a day at a nearby field.
